result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodolfo Ayala-Castillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodolfo Ayala-Castillo

referral form to bail monitoring

AMENDED CASH BOND - REFERRAL TO BMP  
- Cash bond is set in the amount of $15,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 AM on the business day following his release from jail.
-  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Felipe O.S.
